message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: public void sendScreenshot(byte[] buffer) throws IOException {
    OutputStream os = socket.getOutputStream();
    DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(os);
    dos.writeInt(buffer.length + 1);
    dos.writeByte(0);
    dos.write(buffer, 0, buffer.length);
    dos.flush();
}
<<<explanation>>>: In Java, you can use the DataOutputStream class to achieve the same functionality. First, create a DataOutputStream object using the OutputStream of the socket. Then, use the writeInt() method to write the length of the message as an integer (4 bytes). Next, use the writeByte() method to write the command byte. Finally, use the write() method to write the byte array. Remember to flush the DataOutputStream to ensure that all data is sent.
